website_summaries.verdict: An upper-range budget laptop that doesn't skimp on the features. A good pick for those who make high demands on their laptop but have a limited budget.
pros: It has all the latest connectivity options: WiFi, Bluetooth, USB 3.0, USB-C
Enough power and memory for Photoshop and Lightroom
Excellent cooling system that works even under heavy use
cons: Average battery life of about 3 hrs

customer_reviews.title: ... arrived well packaged and just as promised and was easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: The laptop was just as described and arrived well packaged and just as promised and was easy to set up. The Windows 10 OS was a cut above W8 making the installation of software simple and intuitive. I have no way to compare the computers operation with other devices, but was completely satisfied with the purchase. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Great but shell out for a small cheap SSD and make it your system/boot partition or die of frustration.
customer_reviews.text: It is a great computer overall, the hard drive though large is PAINFULLY slow. After reaching m frustration limit I swapped out the HD for a faster one and it the improvement was so noticeable I replaced the DVD with a Caddie and a small SSD as my boot drive, $60 later and the computer is a dream. As is though it is a pain. Word and 3 browsing tabs are all it took to make it unbearable until after the upgrade. Now there is no slowing ti down (well, with normal use).
customer_reviews.author: JAWS78

customer_reviews.title: Couple of small problems, but it works
customer_reviews.text: It's already having some problems after a couple of months. Sometimes it will struggle to load web pages to the point of forcing me to kill them and reload-- and this gets worse and worse until I restart the computer. The problems will start up again within a day or two, sometimes within minutes. Additionally, it will sometimes freeze for nearly a minute when I'm closing out of a computer game program. Manageable problems, though, and other than that the computer has been fine. (Also, there's no light indicating whether or not the number-lock is active...)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good, solid, thin, lightweight laptop
customer_reviews.text: Took awhile to get it set up and had to attempt on-line and phone tech support many times before realizing the biggest limitation was ISP, not hardware. Once set up right, it's been reliable and easy to use. I haven't taken advantage of many features, like cloud storage. Touch-pad is a little hypersensitive, but I realize I can adjust that. Good screen, battery life is still good more than 18 mos after stock date. Good wireless access, rarely dropping signal. Only feature missing is a back-lit keyboard. I don't use memory-intensive programs like gaming, but have no problem streaming videos and movies.
customer_reviews.author: retdoc

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, then upgrade to a SSD
customer_reviews.text: This is a great computer with one hitch, the hard drive is awful. It's not ok, or good, or tolerable, it's certifiably awful. It used to take about 2 minutes or so to boot the computer and another 2 to 5 minutes to actually get the computer to respond. All the other hardware is good to great, and I have no complaints there at all. To fix the speed issue, I installed a new solid state hard drive and the computer is ultra fast. I didn't even bother to upgrade the memory, and it still runs circles around most computers I've used with the stock 4GB of onboard RAM. Buy it, then upgrade the HDD. You'll be pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: battery didnt last
customer_reviews.text: when I received I unpacked it and started it,the battery had plenty of power,,since I hadn't a internet service I stored it in closet no use at all.month ago I tried to get it to function,the battery wouldnt take a charge,i double checked with another charging cable and it still registered battery not charging.assume the battery is not working from almost 2 years of no use at all. estimated cost to replace battery by microcenter cambridge mass 150 dollars minimum
customer_reviews.author: John V.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for office work
customer_reviews.text: Working out great. I bought this for work -- I mainly was concerned with getting an SSD, 8GB RAM, a good-sized monitor, a full-sized keyboard and a bunch of ports. I don't do a lot of graphic or sound work, so the audio and video components weren't a priority for me and these have been fine. Mainly, I was focused on finding a laptop that would accommodate my having multiple programs and windows open simultaneously -- all Office applications (Word, Excel, PPT, Outlook) and several browsers with multiple tabs, for instance. It's been just great, and unbeatable for what I paid. Dell was more than twice the price similarly configured. Hoping it lasts me a while.
customer_reviews.author: D. Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: I should have gotten a Dell...
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box the keyboard has issues. And the audio jack doesn't work. I have never had to hit keys so hard and most of the time the space bar does not respond when struck. Customer support is a total pain in the neck as it takes entering every serial number and model number multiple times to get linked up with a support person. unless of course you want to take your chances at speaking directly to someone who may or may not speak very good English. I regret this purchase. It gets me online but I have to take hand written notes in school as this keyboard is such a hindrance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted a little over two years
customer_reviews.text: Laptop worked great for 2 years and 2 months then died suddenly. I take good care of all my electronics (computer technician for 6 years) and this laptop went from working great to it would turn on. Motherboard is fried. I have no idea how it could’ve happened since it only had light use and stayed on my desk 24/7. Very disappointed at how much money is now down the drain. Will never buy Asus again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P.

customer_reviews.title: Colossal Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: I received this laptop on 3/15/2017. Today is 2/3/2020. So this $600 laptop is not even three years old. I use it to backup my iPhone and to do my budget in excel. That’s it. It powered off and will no longer power on. Took it to my local repair center and they said the CPU is toast. If it isn’t going to last 3 years why drop $600. I WILL NEVER BUY ASUS PRODUCTS AGAIN! It’s out of warranty so tough luck. Such a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Waldrop

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than the pictures portray
customer_reviews.text: The computer is much larger than pictures show. It's not slim by any stretch. It's powerful and runs very well. I decided to return it for two reasons. First, it was bigger than I expected, so I've purchased another computer from ASUS that is slimmer/smaller to meet my portability needs. Also, the second time I turned the computer on to wipe/reset it, the touchpad/mouse stopped working. reset/shutdown hasn't solved this, and I am forced to use an external mouse to get the computer reset. I've had many ASUS products and I'm sure they would have helped me solve this issue. I will continue to buy ASUS but be warned, the pictures make it appear sleek/slim, which it is not.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel

customer_reviews.title: Trackpad ass
customer_reviews.text: There's a lot of small issues with this that make me want to give it a three actually. But overall I like it a lot about a month in. The MAJOR drawback is the dumb placement of the track pad. The placement makes sense if this is intended to be a left handed laptop I guess. Also why can you not turn off track pad gestures completely? The best I've been able to do is only turn some of them off. Edit: This trackpad is AWFUL. Worst I have ever used. Downgrading the rating to a 3 star over that. This is an OK laptop if you don't want to spend a lot, but damn is the trackpad terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Brennan

customer_reviews.title: I'm an Asus fan. I bought this as a ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm an Asus fan. I bought this as a replacement for my work laptop that was stolen out of my car. This is a basic computer that gets all of my work done. However, as a developer and a digital marketing strategist, I often have a ton of tabs open at one time. This computer can only handle that for a few hours and then it starts lagging and greying out. I have to restart it. My other Asus that I use as a backup can stay on for days without any issues so I'm not sure what is going on with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Season P.

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy.
customer_reviews.text: Nice fast Laptop with good hardware. I took one star off due to build quality and track pad. My previous laptop was Asus too and its track pad was smooth. It has 250 gb ssd whic is enough for basic office use and college use. If you need more space you can upgrade it too. Ram is 8 gb which is again enough for basic functions. Screen resolution is very high. It has a basic video card just for basic 3d gaming. Over all it was not a bad purchase. Other companies with same specs might have a laptop much expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Kamran

customer_reviews.title: Best Computer ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best computer I have ever had! The solid state drive is so fast and the whole computer stays cool. My last computer would actually burn my legs when it was on my lap. This is the first time I have owned a Asus computer and I am really impressed. 6 months and not a single problem. Sound is really good although I wish I could put the volume up just slightly. VERY happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Woolleylady

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I got this computer in April and it is already ready for the trash bin (July.) The top fell off the number three key the second month. It goes off when I am using it and now it is caught in a loop shutting down that never ends. It is made out of cheap plastic and nothing like the Asus I had before. It makes me afraid to ever buy another Asus.
customer_reviews.author: corrine

customer_reviews.title: Won't Last
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product just 2 years ago and only used it occasionally, and it has already died!! I have never owned a laptop that died within the first two years, as my last laptop lasted over 10 years. I have taken this laptop to a computer repair of which I am a member and I was told that it is rare for this model to have experienced an unsuccessful RMA.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but I can tell you that it's terrible. It's beyond slow to the point of freezing ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if it's just the computer, or a combo of the computer and Windows10, but I can tell you that it's terrible. It's beyond slow to the point of freezing constantly. When I tried to reset it, it completely crashed and wouldn't start up. I took it to a repair shop. They sent it back to Asus for them to fix. I got it back and it starts up, but is just as slow as before. I actually don't know what I'm going to do because I get so angry when I try to use it I want to throw it on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Alyce

customer_reviews.title: Looked good on paper, very poor performance. Spend your money elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Like it at first because it's lightweight, looks really good, and has good specs on paper. After a couple months, this is a bad laptop no matter what the price. Extremely slow computer to do the simplest of tasks. Forget multitasking. Battery life hasn't been an issue but the sound speakers are abysmal... Full volume is extremely quiet which is incredibly frustrating. You need headphones in to hear anything. Really dissapointed I wasted my money and will be upgrading to a different laptop as soon as I have the money.
customer_reviews.author: Speedy Connzales

customer_reviews.title: Great machine at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great machine at a great price. Good sting case, fast start up- very very pleased so far and expect more of the same. Own a more higher end ASUS for almost 4 years and it still performs well...
customer_reviews.author: K. J.

customer_reviews.title: Not As Happy As I Thought I'd Be
customer_reviews.text: Although the download or upload speed is great, the mousepad and cursor are slow. Also, the cursor moves around too much even when not touching the mousepad. Not really happy with that part, but again, the speed is great. Had I not transferred all of my personal information to the laptop before I really used it, I would have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Francine L Higginbotham

customer_reviews.title: Lightning Fast
customer_reviews.text: This is a great upgrade from my seven year old Sony Vaio. I use my laptop as though it were a desktop most of the time. That means I have a 22 inch monitor, wireless keyboard and mouse and I don't need a touchscreen. This is one of the few laptops with a full sized VGA port. The HDD and core i5 processor make this lightning fast. It doesn't come with much software but that means no bloatware. I added a USB hub because it has only two full sized USB ports built in.
customer_reviews.author: oldJK

customer_reviews.title: Poor support from ASUS
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this laptop as a gift and right around the time the warranty is up, around a year of use the screen decides it wants to quit working. The laptop is so lightly used and the battery has been lackluster in life usually lasting about 2 hours before needing a charge ever since new. All this is used for is surfing the web. I sent multiple requests for support from asus and it takes a week for a response. the last message I recieved they informed me it was a day out of warranty and they were sorry I was not happy. I will never buy another ASUS product again poor support! poor product! beware
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A suitable choice for home computing needs
customer_reviews.text: This has been a quality computer for the price. Among the many pros are: adequate battery life, adequate storage space, a thinner profile for a 15" laptop, economically priced. Look no further if you are looking for a less expensive computer for home computing needs (i.e. word processing, web browsing, educational tool for children etc.).
customer_reviews.author: Gavril

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic laptop. Ordered about a year ago and no ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic laptop. Ordered about a year ago and no issues yet. I am not a techy person, but used a MacBook Pro for years prior to the Asus, but my most recent MacBook crapped out on me after 3 years, and my local repair shop charged me $350, and at long last could not fix the beast. $1200 dead after 3 years was not impressive performance to me. So switched back to Windows, and so far so good. Asus will now be my go to brand.
customer_reviews.author: House of FurBaby

customer_reviews.title: Asia Comes Through Yet Again!
customer_reviews.text: I built custom computers for 11 years, using Asus motherboards, with very good experience. This is an excellent Laptop, at an awesome price. I couldn't be more pleased. It's light weight, it has vibrant colors, and sounds absolutely great for a laptop. The only minus is that it doesn't have an input to the sound system, so I can't record audio tracks, but there's a lot of reasonably priced USB sound systems on the market that'll serve that function just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Walley

customer_reviews.title: Order an additional 4GB of RAM at the same time as ordering this laptop!
customer_reviews.text: If you decide this laptop meets your needs, then you better order WITH IT an additional 4GB of RAM!!!! The 4GB of RAM it comes with hardly enough to load Windows 10 and everything else will not work or work very, very slowly. The day after I booted up the laptop for the first time I ordered Kingston Technology ValueRAM 4GB 2133MHz DDR4 Non-ECC CL15 SODIMM 1Rx8 Laptop Memory (KVR21S15S8/4) which did the job after I installed it (which is very easy to do). Only AFTER installing an additional 4GB of RAM would I give this very nice laptop for the money four stars.
customer_reviews.author: newsvision

customer_reviews.title: So slooooooow!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible computer. So slow. I would not have bought it if I knew it was going to take so long to startup and so slow to do anything. I bought the version with windows 7 because windows 10 killed my last 2 computers. So sad.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Cooper

customer_reviews.title: It lasted for 1 year and 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Well I had the laptop for about 1 year and 2 months and it crapped out all of a sudden after performing a Windows update. I successfully updated my desktop and another laptop with no issues. Asus has the laptop right now and waiting for estimate since it's out of warranty. I will update this review once the laptop is repaired.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Asus is a great brand, however, spend the extra money for more memory and better processor
customer_reviews.text: I like Asus products, my old laptop took a lot of abuse and lasted for over 5 years. When I needed to replace it, I, unfortunately, went with this cheaper option with only 4GB of Memory and an i3 core processor. I regret that decision. It is pitifully incapable of handling basic functions without freezing or crashing. I've stripped quite a lot of extra programs out just to try and get it open a web browser and not freeze for 30-60 seconds, which is not an exaggeration. I would highly recommend Asus products, but invest in options with better memory and processors, despite the extra cost.
customer_reviews.author: na

customer_reviews.title: I am a gamer and I love this laptop
customer_reviews.text: I really like my new laptop. people are right when they say it is more of a silver then a gold HOWEVER! the picture shows it as more of a silver then a gold and what you see in the picture is what you get. I love it, it runs fast, and starts up fast. It was well worth every penny, set up was easy. I have 0 negative things to say. Also I play world of warcraft on it.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: This is the first one I purchased myself (with his recommendation) and I like it very much
customer_reviews.text: I know nothing about computers because my brother is in the business and always gets them for me. This is the first one I purchased myself (with his recommendation) and I like it very much. It doesn't come with Word or Excel, but that may be typical. It doesn't light up so I never know if I've accidentally hit Num Lock, Insert, Cap Lock, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Philautia

customer_reviews.title: Would not reccomend.
customer_reviews.text: Not even 1 week into use of this product and it quit functioning on me. Would not turn on at all. After reading deep into the reviews I realized that this was a common problem. Only positive part of this transaction was the pain free return.
customer_reviews.author: David Hamblin

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop for the price with a couple caveats.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic laptop for the price. Boot time is super short and almost everything runs great at a fraction of the cost of less-equipped laptops. Only thing: right out of the box the bluetooth didn't work and even with help from tech support and updates it never worked. I had to get a mouse with a usb bluetooth adapter to use a wireless mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Quardt

customer_reviews.title: I love it. It came with some software I didnt ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it. It came with some software I didnt want and cant remove, but has plenty of storage so it doesnt slow it down any. I have A LOT of stuff on it and it hasnt slowed down at all. Will be buying another ASUS whenever I get another computer.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: AVOID this laptop!
customer_reviews.text: This laptop is the BIGGEST HEADACHE! The system is having internal issues and does not work properly. I've had to ship it off to the ASUS service center, they returned it with no change to the issue and now have to send it in again to the ASUS service center for them to try to fix the issues again. Its so frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: Trie

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy from Asus
customer_reviews.text: My laptop died in 2 years. Cost $600 originally. Wanted $800 to fix it. A computer should last more than 2 years. So I essentially rented this for $300 per year and have nothing to show for it. Will not buy an Asus product again.
customer_reviews.author: Elise Freedman

customer_reviews.title: OS corrupted out of the box spent a day fixing ...
customer_reviews.text: OS corrupted out of the box spent a day fixing it so it would take updates. Also, would rather get a laptop with physical left and right buttons for the touchpad instead of it blending into the touch area. 3 stars for specs for the price.
customer_reviews.author: DaveAvenger

customer_reviews.title: just the perfect laptop
customer_reviews.text: just the perfect laptop. lighting fast, excellent life battery, greate sound, CERO fan sound and CERO heat.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Alvarado

customer_reviews.title: ASUS Computer
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best computers I have come across. I have been building and repairing computers for over 30 years and this is the fastest I have had. I have 2 more computers with I5 CPU's and SSD hard drives that aren't near as fast. ASUS must have a motherboard secret that I don't know about. For a home compute, I would recommend this computer over any I've seen. Since this is a sealed computer I can't get the name of the SSD. The computer boots in about 8 seconds or less and pages open instantly. I have only had the computer for a short time so I can't attest to it's reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Russell D Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 24 months
customer_reviews.text: Very slow..Kept freezing. I called ASUS and they charged me $60 + $260 to repair it. What a huge waste of money. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bailarin

customer_reviews.title: -lovely display -fast - pretty decent battery life - literally a functioning computer Cons
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this laptop for a few days, but so far it's mostly worked well! Pros: -lovely display -fast - pretty decent battery life - literally a functioning computer Cons: -It came in the made with bumps and bruises on the side and the top, as if it had taken a hard fall. -The webcam is absolutely horrible, a flip phone could take a better picture -If you move more than four feet from the mic it will not recieve input
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: and I notice that the there is something wrong with the hinges that cause it to not close all the way like it should
customer_reviews.text: I bought this computer a few month ago, and I notice that the there is something wrong with the hinges that cause it to not close all the way like it should. Im very very very disappointed because this is a factory failure and there was nothing about this on the description of the computer and now reading reviews about this product there are some people complaing about this. My computer is still in warranty, but I live in Uruguay and I would really like a solution for this problem..
customer_reviews.author: Mili Garicoits

customer_reviews.title: The weight is good enough to take around as a student
customer_reviews.text: so far its working well. the only thing i forgot to check before i bought it was if the keyboard has lighting. found out it does not and it very muchneeded when doing work at night. The weight is good enough to take around as a student. If you deal a lot with numbers for school, etc. then this laptop is the perfect one. Keyboard is quite spacious.
customer_reviews.author: trish

customer_reviews.title: BEST PC EVER
customer_reviews.text: BEST PC EVER. This computer is impressive. I've had all types of laptops and ended up sticking with HP but they really went down in quality over the years. Let me tell you I did a lot of hw before I got this laptop and I am super happy that I bought it. Unfortunately, the price has gone up by around $300 since I bought it so it's a bit expensive but it's worth it. Totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mastayugi91

customer_reviews.title: but it's good build quality and works very well for my needs ...
customer_reviews.text: It's on the heavier side than I hoped for, but it's good build quality and works very well for my needs as an undergraduate student. Charger is bulky at the wall but I prefer that to having an adapter in the middle.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: best laptop I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: Intel core I5 Blue: best laptop I have ever used. Bought one for the non-profit I volunteered for, they loved it. Two weeks later I bought one for myself. After unpacking the laptop, it sets itself up. Then I clean installed latest Win 10, reformatting the SSD. After removing the useless Apps with Ccleaner it works great! Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: ASUS
customer_reviews.text: Pro: quick start up Great battery life Works great with both business applications and some light gaming Con: only con I can come up with is the 0 on the number pad. Due to it's smaller size than on other keyboards, I invariably hit the right arrow instead of the 0. That's barely even a complaint. Great computer. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Jaeger

customer_reviews.title: This laptop...
customer_reviews.text: I love my laptop but the hinges now cause it to not close all the way like it should. Had some problems getting it started. I made the mistake not to but you should purchase the warranty!
customer_reviews.author: Haley Sexton

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like it, but the one I got was defective ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like it, but the one I got was defective and I ended up returning it. The computer turned on but the screen was pitch black the ENTIRE time. I couldn't even see the screen and start the set up process without shining a separate light on it. Even after I managed to get past the set up phase and play with the settings, it did nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Chuu Li

customer_reviews.title: It's a great simple laptop for school
customer_reviews.text: It's a great simple laptop for school. I've had no issues with overheating or it being slow. I use it frequently. It looks very nice and fancy.
customer_reviews.author: L.L

customer_reviews.title: Very slow!!!
customer_reviews.text: Slowest computer I have ever had. Takes forever even to open the internet. Can't do anything. It is extremely frustrating. The SD card slot shorts out as well... wish I would have returned it but I didn't use it much when I first got it.
customer_reviews.author: krystalnicole

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the performance and resolution. Couple of things I don't like are the lack of an indicator on the caps lock key and the spacebar. Not sure if anyone else who purchased this laptop noticed the spacebar sticking or being unresponsive, but I certainly struggle with it on occasion. Other than those minor snafus, I like this machine - especially at the price - and would recommend to others..
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Not a good choice, waste of money
customer_reviews.text: After one year hard drive crashed, and I need to throw it away. Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: kiarash

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: Only had it for 2 days. When I first used it had to reset network adapter because it wasn't working properly. Today I updated windows and my track pad doesn't work and updating the driver doesn't fix it. Nice fast computer but too many problems for a brand new computer
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop for university
customer_reviews.text: Great laptop for university, quick and working good so far.. its been a month. -Almost silent fan and has not yet overheated. -The battery life is incredible - sleek looking, finish on casing is very nice Some minor things that bothered me- -Spacebar was less sensitive on one side, but constant use sorted this -No light on the caps lock/ no indication on screen when caps lock is pressed -Speaker is not in ideal position,it is louder if you lift up the laptop (being picky) Hope it stays this way, only time will tell
customer_reviews.author: Ominderjit Singh

customer_reviews.title: Good price, Good laptop
customer_reviews.text: First off, I am not a huge fan of the metallic cover for the laptop, it gives me goosebumps whenever I attempt to close/open my laptop. Besides that, so far the laptop has been perfection. Although, the 4gb of ram it came with can be slow from time to time. So to address that issue, I upgraded it to 8gb of ram and it has been far superior ever since.
customer_reviews.author: mark84g5

customer_reviews.title: It's like being able to breathe in all the way again
customer_reviews.text: High quality machine that runs so much faster than my last one. It's like being able to breathe in all the way again. Only problem is the audio simply goes out on a semi-regular basis. Resetting the machine fixes it, but it comes up nearly daily.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful! No bloatware, no problems, wish I had gotten sooner
customer_reviews.text: Works wonderfully. No bloatware. Haven't had any problems. Wish I had gotten this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Guinevere Lee

customer_reviews.title: Dead at 4 months.
customer_reviews.text: After about 4 months the thing just died. Was sitting in the table and the screen went black. Never been dropped or anything. Asus customer service offered to fix it if we mailed it in. They were pretty good and helpful but we decided to sent it back to Amazon for a refund. What is it with electronics these days?
customer_reviews.author: LarryRL

customer_reviews.title: Good midrange machine at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Super quick boot time thanks to the ssd and clean looks. The number pad leaves a bit to be desired as the keys are unconventional but it could be worse. Solid deal if you're no thanks looking to break the bank but still get a decent laptop that can do most everyday tasks with ease.
customer_reviews.author: CHAZMUNNY

customer_reviews.title: Two laptops...both defective.
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this laptop and within a week the motherboard or hard drive died rendering it useless. Amazon replaced the item quickly but once again the laptop was defective. The second laptop had an issue and the speakers would not work despite updating the drivers. Stay away from the laptop. Normally ASUS are good but this model...not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Chad and Kim

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, but could be faster.
customer_reviews.text: Over all, I have been happy with this computer. However, I thought it would be a little faster. I believe it needs another 4 or 8 gig of RAM which I understand is cheaply and easily done as only one of the slots is filled. In the mean time, I changed my display resolution settings to 1600 X 900 and everything runs much faster. I will be buying more RAM so that I can run at full HD.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: A computer is only as good as your internet connection. Otherwise...blazing fast!
customer_reviews.author: JOHN B M MASTERS

customer_reviews.title: Okay for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It's okay for the price. It was pretty slow when I got it. Ended up putting more RAM and an SSD in it, which it really needed. Probably would've been better off buying a more expensive laptop to begin with. The screen isn't very good. It looks bad if you're not looking at it straight on. The case is kind of plasticky and clunky, but it's not horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Ted A. Cary

customer_reviews.title: Overally good but charging giving trouble
customer_reviews.text: Good laptop but there is a problem with the charging. IT says plugged in but not charging.I searched some info on Google to fix it but didn't apply it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Yavuz Doner

customer_reviews.title: Best laptop for a steal
customer_reviews.text: Best laptop for a steal! Beats my Lenovo that I paid almost triple for. This is light weight, bright and durable. Great battery life!
customer_reviews.author: April Elzholz

customer_reviews.title: ... this a few months ago and my laptop works great. It's fast too
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a few months ago and my laptop works great. It's fast too. The only negative thing that i don't like about it is the screen part. It's plastic and it feels like it's going to break easily. I'm so scared of putting something on top of it because it might mess up my screen.
customer_reviews.author: MaTheresa Colon

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: This laptop was as advertised. The seller was quick to ship.
customer_reviews.author: suzanne scavuzzo

customer_reviews.title: Everything I needed
customer_reviews.text: A great machine for my use. Mainly Office apps, email, pictures...everyday stuff for a 70-year old woman. Wish it had a backlit keyboard, but I probably shouldn't type in the dark, anyway.
customer_reviews.author: E. Hoogland

customer_reviews.title: I love ASUS but I wish I would have returned this
customer_reviews.text: Has operated very slowly from day 1 but I guess it gets the job done. I love ASUS but I wish I would have returned this. I only use this for my school work even though I intended to use it for other things. It's just too frustrating with how slow it is.
customer_reviews.author: brittaney ramsey

customer_reviews.title: As always, Asus rocks!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Asus machine and as usual, they did not disappoint. Nice and light, with the SSD the battery last about 7 hours and is very fast.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great machine and just the power she needs for her ...
customer_reviews.text: My wife's Compaq laptop developed a severe hard drive problem so I decided to try ASUS. Great machine and just the power she needs for her work. Delivery was on-tme and double boxed for shipping safety. Nice job Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Galaxy

customer_reviews.title: should have bought a mac
customer_reviews.text: i've gone back and forth between mac and pc over the decades and I guess I decided which camp i'm in
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Bare Root

customer_reviews.title: This laptop isn’t worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Used this lap tap about once a week. Mainly to pay bills online. Sometimes didn’t use it for weeks. Had to reboot once and now it won’t even come on! It’s worthless! Don’t waste your money!!
customer_reviews.author: Martha J Heath

customer_reviews.title: A great machine with a couple of flaws
customer_reviews.text: Screen was slightly disappointing, and the trackpad is pretty horrible, but other than that it's a great machine. Runs everything real snappy and boots unbelievablely fast.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Phillips

customer_reviews.title: The person I bought this computer for is very pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: The person I bought this computer for is very pleased with it. I tested this computer before I gave it to her and it booted quickly and applications installed quickly also. The screen was decent looking but viewing angle wasn't that good but it was about what I expected for the price. All in all this computer is a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: A Member

customer_reviews.title: Overall has been a pretty good computer
customer_reviews.text: Overall has been a pretty good computer. It's on the bigger side but for the price that was okay. It will occasionally turn off for no reason which is the only thing I haven't liked about it.
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: Motherboard fried after two years
customer_reviews.text: Bought this laptop and the motherboard fried two years later. Up till then it was nothing but other problems. I’d give zero stars if I could. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Anderson

customer_reviews.title: I would give it 5 stars but it has the old HDMI
customer_reviews.text: This will project 4k onto a tv or monitor but its limited to 30ghz because it still has the HDMI 1.4
customer_reviews.author: Bradley D Trisdale

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: It works great! I love this laptop has the perfect screen size for me. I like the sleek look it has, very slim and is very quite once tuned on.
customer_reviews.author: NCantu

customer_reviews.title: Broke after four months of use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this laptop aproximately four months ago. Yesterday, while I was using it, some odd collors appeared on the screen and then it shut down. Now it wont turn up again. And I am trying to get ASUS support to fix it. I suspect this was actually a refurbished product sold as new. Dont buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Was looking forward for this laptop but the one I ...
customer_reviews.text: Was looking forward for this laptop but the one I order came with a defective keyboard. Sent it back the same day :( what a letdown!
customer_reviews.author: zenzen

customer_reviews.title: Good at first, then battery dies quickly
customer_reviews.text: This computer is nice light and quick speed. It will be a year since I have purchased it in January. However, the battery has all of the sudden plummeted in the last month it used to last about 6 hours now I'm lucky if I can get 2. Which is disappointing to me because I had an Asus before this that was 6 years old and held a charge better than my new one.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Hager

customer_reviews.title: Laptop does not work when unplugged.
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware! I purchased 6 of these computers, 3 of them do not work when they are unplugged. One was purchased 2 weeks ago. When I called ASUS directly and they told me there was nothing they could do because the computer was out of warranty. I have returned the computer purchased and would caution anyone from buying this model. ASUS F556UA-AB54 NB 15.6" FHD Intel Core i5...
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie R

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst. piece of trash. I have ever bought. It was a Christmas present to help make my schoolwork more mobile. School started a week ago, I started using this laptop a day and a half ago, and it is so incredibly slow and keeps shutting down the windows I'm working in after they become nonresponsive. It's making schoolwork harder, not easier, and I plan to return it. *Edit* following advice from the seller, my husband fixed the problems I was having with this laptop. I changed my review from 1 star to 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far everything is good. Love the keyboard and general look of the ...
customer_reviews.text: So far everything is good. Love the keyboard and general look of the laptop. Sturdy build and great screen resolution. Kinda reminds me of a MacBook... the battery life is long and everything loads quickly! Will update if I run into problems later on.
customer_reviews.author: Bambi Eyes

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Everything about the computer is wonderful. I give it 4 stars because the first one I received inexplicably quit charging. Amazon customer service was great. They sent me a new one before I even sent the first one back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mom Likes It
customer_reviews.text: Mom likes it. No issues in approximately 6 months. The color is not the same in real life. It's decent.
customer_reviews.author: disgruntled upon occasion

customer_reviews.title: Pleased so far
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Have read some bad reviews, however this has not been the case so far. Gave as a present. Recipient has good thing to say about this tool for online degree program.
customer_reviews.author: Teao

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in Asus
customer_reviews.text: Computer looks great, but was extremely slow, and wifi would not work at all. This is the second Asus I have had issues with in the last month. Will be buying a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would highly recommend getting the next model up with 6G RAM and ...
customer_reviews.text: VERY slow with installed components. I would highly recommend getting the next model up with 6G RAM and an SSD. I upgraded this one and it is MUCH better, but ended up paying the same as if I had bought the one with more RAM, SDD, and the i5.
customer_reviews.author: Waffle

customer_reviews.title: :ove the speed and ease of use
customer_reviews.text: 'I am still learning how to use this advanced computer with all the bells and whistles one needs in this technical world, but I love the speed as I had been using a 10 year old computer that would take 5 - 10 minutes to load anything, so I'm old and easy to please.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Schuetz

customer_reviews.title: My daughter is extremely pleased with her new computer
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is extremely pleased with her new computer. I don't think we could have gotten a better deal after using the computer for a few days we realized it is very fast and fun to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would look for something else that works better with windows 10
customer_reviews.text: Nothing but problems can't be on for long before windows 10 blue screens.Yes screens I'be tried all the fixes .At least 6 different blue screens shut down and restart computer.Says everything is ok when check individual software and drivers.Bought for using music instrument interface and recording. Nothing but problems even when software removed.Windows 10 seems to be the issue but it came with this laptop.I would look for something else that works better with windows 10.
customer_reviews.author: vincewon

customer_reviews.title: glares on the screen are terrible. At max
customer_reviews.text: The audio is awful, glares on the screen are terrible. At max, the battery last 2 hours. The keys are loud....I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Momof2

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for buck and no sacrifice on performance at all!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 5 of these after trying trying many other brands at our office. Best bang for buck by a large margin. ONLY drawback is not back lit keys.
customer_reviews.author: Breanne Warkenton

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop!
customer_reviews.text: Top notch laptop, it is better than expected. Functions well, setup and preps very simple. The only thing I missed having was the Product Key for Windows 10. Programs I want to use are unavailable without the Key! Trying to get it through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: WHIP MASTER

customer_reviews.title: Great midgrade laptop
customer_reviews.text: Great midgrade laptop. Can do anything you need it to do. Not for gaming but you can play some old/ non graphic intensive games when you get bored of doing school work or whatever.
customer_reviews.author: jake root

customer_reviews.title: It has been good so far
customer_reviews.text: It has been good so far, it is fast that much that I can tell you. The problem I have it the track pad not as sensitive when I tap it. I have not stress the batter to see how long it would last but so far the battery life is good.
customer_reviews.author: Derval Donald

product_meta.title: ASUS F556UA-AB54-BL 15.6" FHD, Thin and Light Laptop, Intel Core i5, 8GB DDR4 RAM, 256GB SSD, Windows 10 (Blue)
product_meta.description: Style:Intel Core i5 BlueASUS F556UA-AB54-BL 15.6" FHD, Thin and Light Laptop, Intel Core i5, 8GB DDR4 RAM, 256GB SSD, Windows 10 (Blue). 1x Headphone-out & Audio-in Combo Jack; 1x RJ45 LAN Jack for LAN insert; 1x VGA Port (D-Sub); 1x HDMI; 1x USB 2.0; 1x USB 3.0; 1x USB3.1 Type C (gen 1).
feature_bullets: Powerful 15.6" Full HD laptop with latest 7th-generation Intel Core i5 processor, 2.5 GHz (Turbo up to 3.1GHz)
Thin and light design for superior portability weighing only 5.1 lbs. and 1" thin profile
Fast memory and storage for superior boot times and multitasking. Equipped with 256GB SSD and 8GB DDR4 RAM
Extensive connectivity with HDMI/D-SUB/USB Type C, 802.11a/c Wi-Fi, and SD Card Reader
Long-lasting 38 Whr polymer battery 2.5 times the lifespan of standard Li-ion

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars735 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
